intro: Gonatia, commonly known as the mistletoe of the genus Gonatia, is a type of parasitic plant belonging to the family Viscaceae. It grows on the branches of host trees, typically in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has small, scale-like leaves and produces small, fleshy berries that contain seeds. Gonatia species are often found in humid environments and rely on birds for seed dispersal. Its botanical structure is adapted for a parasitic lifestyle, with specialized roots that attach to the host plant for nutrient absorption.
